alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Meade; Seward (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 4:52PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Seward, Meade and southeastern Haskell Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 452 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Satanta to 8 miles northwest of Forgan. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sublette around 505 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Meade State Park, Tice, Missler and Meade. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
